overview_of_class:
We investigate three advanced topics in electricity and magnetism beyond what is covered in Physics 333-1,2.

1) Electromagnetic Radiation - accelerated charges radiate, and this is the basis for communication and
many natural phenomena. Subtle issues linking causality and the space and time domains are important to this topic.

2) Wave Optics - the wave properties of light are responsible for diffraction and interference phenomena.
The basis for these phenomena lies in electro-magnetic theory.

3) Special Relativity - in contrast to mechanics, the laws of electrodynamics are already consistent with
Einstein's theory of special relativity. This theory is explained and related to the electrodynamics in detail.
name: Classical Optics and Special Relativity
subject: PHYSICS
